titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

scopecontent.p: Collection of early seventeenth-century state documents from Great Britain, given to the Library Company of Philadelphia by Henry [Hamilton] Cox, author, from Ireland and Philadelphia. Collection includes: two compendia, 1609, 1614, of court officers, including salaries; summary inventory of properties of King James I; and a letter of instructions, June 5, 1614, for Sir Arthur Chichester, Knight Baron of Belfast, and lord-deputy of Ireland, signed and sealed by James I on various topics, such as establishment of the means of religious reformation.

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.
